page.title: 05GOLF COURSE AT NEW DELAVAL
page.content: An eighteen hole golf course was opened at New Delaval in 1976. There are 700 playing members and the annual subscription is Â£88 for men and Â£65 for women. The course was built on the derelict industrial site of the New Delaval Colliery(sunk in 1859, closed 1958). The only visible evidence of its previous use is an electricity substation and the pit shaft which houses pumps to prevent Bates Colliery workings from flooding. To preserve a link with the past, holes on the golf course have been given names which relate to the old colliery village and the pit.:_ { 6th. Dicki Pit}for the Richard Pit sunk in 1859 { 8th. Moorlands}was a coal seam. {13th. Sinkers}after Sinkers Row where the men who sank the pit shafts lived.
